msDesc.head: WILLIAM OF MACCLESFIELD, ALAN OF LILLE &c.; S. XIII, XIV, XV

physDesc.p: Four originally separate books or booklets, probably first together in the present binding: there is a title of s. xvii on f. 123.

supportDesc.extent:
149 leaves (ii + 147) 205 150
The edges savagely retrimmed, sometimes affecting text at the foredge, and spattered with red. Fols. 146–7 are of thick, stiff parchment.
supportDesc.collation: A bifolium at each end, 1–312, 410, 5–712, 88 / 9–1010 / 1112 / 128, 136, 148, a singleton; quires 1–7 have catchwords.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii, sewn on four bands; formerly chained from the usual position. Fols. 90 and 147 were pastedowns in different earlier bindings.

history.provenance: There is no evidence that the book was at the College prior to s. xvii in.
A single-line inscription has been erased from f. i: ‘Caucio s. l liberand’ pro vi s. viii d. de 5 ff’.
On f. 90, erased, is ‘Pignus fratris G. de Stangraue pro [cropped]’. The place is Stonegrave (Yorks., N. Riding).
At the head of f. iiv is ‘Corruptorium Sancti Thome cum multis contentis aliis prec’ xiii s. iiii d.’, s. xiv.
This is repeated, in almost the same words, at the head of f. ii, s. xv.
At the foredge of f. 91 is the mark of a single strap.

Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with a table of contents and ‘D. 4, 14’ (canc.), s. xvii, and ‘P. 4. 18. Art:’, canc. and replaced with ‘C. 1. 17’ and ‘E. 1. 3’ in red, both canc. and replaced with ‘P. 1. 7’, and ‘No. 267’ in pencil; the College bookplate, sideways. ‘18’ is inked on the foredge.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

msItem.author: ?WILLIAM OF MACCLESFIELD OP
msItem.title: Correctorium Corruptorii ‘Quaestione’
msItem.incipit: Questione xii. art. 2 querens utrum essentia diuersa uideatur ab intellectu creato per aliquanta similitudine mediata
msItem.explicit: quamuis illa interim contingat nostram industriam latere. Explicit et expliceat.
msItem.note: The unique copy of the work of an English Dominican, ed. J.-P. Muller, Le Correctorium Corruptorii ‘Quaestione’. Texts anonyme du ms. Merton 267 (Studia Anselmiana 35: Rome, 1954), reviewed by D. Callus in Bulletin Thomiste, 9 (1954–6), 643–55; Kaeppeli 1578; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 784.
The rest of f. 89vb and f. 90rv are covered with faint pencil notes.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 36 lines (fols. 47–57 44 lines).

decoDesc.decoNote: Blue initials on f. 1, otherwise initials in red or ink of text highlighted with red, red paraphs.

msItem.title: Liber Penitentialis
msItem.incipit: Nouerit ergo fraternitas tua quia tres sunt acciones penitentium in ecclesia usitate ... nisi ante mortem fuerit ecclesie reconciliatus. Ecce mi frater in Christo dilecte .N. libellum ad te de danda penitencia
msItem.explicit: quilibet etiam opilio. Vale et ora pro me.
msItem.note: Unpr.; Bloomfield 3458, here without the prologue (1674).

msItem.title: De Penitentia
msItem.incipit: Qui autem implere poterit quod in penitenciali scriptum est
msItem.note: Followed by ‘Deditus usure, faciens incendia, falsus’ (6 lines, from Robert Grosseteste’s Templum Domini), and ‘Sit tibi potus aqua cibus aridus aspera uestis’ (9 lines; WIC 18341).

msItem.author: RICHARD OF PRÉMONTRÉ
msItem.title: De Canone Missae
msItem.incipit: In uirtute sancte crucis et in sacramento altaris magna est conuenientia
msItem.explicit: et coram Deo gratiam inueniat amen.
msItem.note: On f. 110v verses ‘Percuciens clericum Romam petat excipiuntur’ (13 lines), notes and pen trials, including a substantial paragraph beg. ‘Consecrationes uel precationes sunt omnia uerba que fiunt iuxta uel ante consecrationem’.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 40 lines. Written above top line.

handDesc.handNote: In an English early gothic bookhand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Unfilled spaces for coloured initials; rubrication.

msItem.author: ROBERT KILWARDBY OP
msItem.title: Letter to Peter of Conflans, archbishop of Corinth, defending the Oxford condemnations of March 1277
msItem.incipit: Reuerendo patri fratri per Dei gratia archiepiscopo Corinth’ frater Robertus Cantuariensis
Scripsistis mihi nuper quod uenerabilis pater dominus episcopus Parisiensis uobis significauit
msItem.note: Ed. F. Ehrle, Gesammelte Aufsätze zur englischen Scholastik (Rome, 1978), pp. 18–44; Glorieux, Arts 411ax; Kaeppeli 3530; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 563.

msItem.title: Lists of errors condemned at Oxford and Paris
msItem.rubric: Collectio errorum condempnatorum in Anglia qui sic per capitula distinguntur.
msItem.incipit: (f. 117v) Isti sunt errores detestabiles contra theologicam ueritatem reperti in quibusdam scriptis quos quicumque dogmatizauerit uel defenderit a uenerabili patre Guillelmo Parisiensi episcopo euocato consilio
(f. 118) Isti sunt errores condempnati et excommunicati cum omnibus qui eos docuerint scienter uel assereuerint a domino Stephano Parysiensi episcopo anno Domini M. CC LXX
msItem.note: The Condemnations of Robert Kilwardby, 1277, William of Auvergne, 1241, and Stephen Temper, 1277. ed. Denifle & Châtelain I, pp. 558–60, 170–2, 543–8; Glorieux, Théol. 8c.

msItem.title: Quaestiones

msItem.incipit: Vtrum uegetatiua et sensitiua et intellectiua in humana sint una substantia. Videtur quod sic quia unius perfectionis est una perfectio
Vtrum uegetatiua et sensitiua exeant in esse per generationem

msItem.note: In an anglicana of scholastic type, are two quaestiones, i. e. the twelfth of the errors condemned in art. 5, and ‘Vtrum uegetatiua et sensitiua exeant in esse per generationem’.

msItem.title: Eight of the articles condemned by Archbishop John Pecham
msItem.note: In a rough anglicana, cropped at the foredge. ed. T. C. Martin, Registrum Epistolarum Fratris Iohannis Peckham (3 vols, RS, 1882–5), III, pp. 921–3.

extent.note: The outer edge of the text is cropped throughout.
